prompt.content: Using Nestlé S.A.’s 2024 consolidated financial statements,If interest paid, taxes paid, and dividends paid to non-controlling interests are treated as non-operating and non-recurring for valuation purposes, what would be the adjusted operating cash flow for 2024 (in CHF millions) after removing these items from reported operating cash flow?

messages.content: [{"criteria":"Reported operating cash flow for 2024 is CHF 16,675 million","operator":"correctness"},{"criteria":"Interest paid of CHF 1,539 million identify ","operator":"correctness"},{"criteria":"it should then add back to operating cash flow when computing the adjusted operating cash flow","operator":"correctness"},{"criteria":"Taxes paid of CHF 2,411 million is identify ","operator":"correctness"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"it should then add back to operating cash flow when computing the adjusted operating cash flow"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Dividends paid to non-controlling interests of CHF 174 million "},{"criteria":"it is financing activity item","operator":"correctness"},{"criteria":"should be added back to operating cash flow in order to identify what is attributed to parent company ","operator":"correctness"},{"criteria":"Calculate \n16,675 +1,539 + 2,411 +174 = 20,799","operator":"correctness"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"7.\tFinal answer CHF 20,799 million"},{"criteria":"Final answer is in CHF millions","operator":"correctness"}]
